meanings.definition: A person who abates or diminishes something.
meanings.sent1: The abator helped decrease the noise in the library by reminding people to whisper.
meanings.sent2: The abator was known for his ability to reduce conflicts among his coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The abator made the party more peaceful by calming down the argumentative guests.
meanings.sent4: She was like an abator of chaos, bringing order wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The abator's presence in the meeting instantly lowered the tension in the room.

meanings.definition: A person who removes or destroys something.
meanings.sent1: The abator cleared out the old furniture to make space for the new ones.
meanings.sent2: The abator was hired to demolish the abandoned building.
meanings.sent3: The abator accidentally deleted all the files from the computer.
meanings.sent4: The storm acted as a natural abator, tearing down the weak structures.
meanings.sent5: The abator swiftly got rid of the pest infestation in the house.

meanings.definition: A person who reduces the value of something.
meanings.sent1: The dishonest abator manipulated the prices to make the products seem cheaper.
meanings.sent2: The abator's negative review significantly lowered the value of the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous abator swapped the expensive painting with a fake one.
meanings.sent4: Her careless handling of the antique vase turned her into an unintentional abator.
meanings.sent5: The abator's counterfeit products devalued the entire market.
